title: Don't install
comment: 189 mb ram ONLY FOR THIS? G T F O

Accessibility and notification services can incur a bit higher memory usage because of what Android runs when they are running, but if other foreground apps need the memory, Android handles pausing or reallocating memory as needed, you shouldn't notice any impact from this service.

title: Needs a few tweaks...
comment: Overall good app, that will generally do what is needed.  Needs the ability to change to phone default screen turn off time after the screen is touched.  As of now, it will turn off the screen x amount of seconds after the screen turns on to show the notification no matter what.  Another update should be the ability to turn on the screen at a selected brightness setting, and then change to phone default setting once screen is touched.  This way the screen could turn on at a very dim level conserving battery, unless touched, then it would default to regular brightness level.

I just want my screen to turn on at lowest brightness level (just for the sake of battery) and if I touch the screen, the brightness level will go back to my actual brightness settings. title: Does one thing very well.
comment: Many notification apps can wake up the screen but then the display timeout defaults to the system setting. I want a much shorter timeout for notifications than what I set for normal device use. This app solves that problem by letting me have an independent display timeout setting just for notifications. It pairs nicely with other pop-up notification apps. You may need to experiment with this app's proximity sensor setting and display brightness setting to get it just right, but the good news is that those options are there for those who need them.

comment: Dont download! !!
This crash has been fixed

title: No comment
comment: This sucks people lie
If you're having problems, feel free to email me. I'm pretty sure 100s of reviews don't lie

title: Awesome
comment: Amazing app just what I was looking for I went from iPhone to Xperia z1 and hated that the screen didn't come on when I got a notification this app was my savour thanks developer amazing job!!!

title: Not bad
comment: Please get the  experimental option working to expand the notification tray on Nexus 5. Also no offense but the icon is seriously ugly ;-)

Expanding the notification tray is no longer supported on newer versions of Android, there is no way to make it work. 
Screen Notifications is open source (https://github.com/lkorth/screen-notifications), if you don't like the icon, feel free to submit a pull request

title: Briefly wakes screen to displays notifications
comment: Most apps that are supposed to wake the screen to show notifications wake the screen no matter what, even if your phone is in your bag or in your pocket, which kills the battery. I have an HTC One X+ and was looking for an app that uses my phone's proximity sensor to detect when I am near the screen and when it's in my pocket / face down and then wake the screen accordingly. This app works really well to wake the screen at the appropriate times. The only issue I have is that sometimes the screen wakes up on it's own, even when I don't have a notification.

title: Talk Back Bug
comment: Keeps turning on Talk Back. Very iritating. Would be great if it weren't doing it.

Screen Notifications is not turning on talk back, Samsung created a bug in several of their phones that causes talk back to always run when ever accessibility services are on and this will happen with any app that uses accessibility services.

title: Simple and good
comment: Thanks

title: Wnt
comment: Won't work on my galaxy s4. All I wanted this app for was to turn my screen in when I get a text. Won't work but I'm sure us good on other phones

title: Works great
comment: Thanks for this app...

title: Works on HTC One!
comment: Does what it says it will. Just needs a repeat alert feature, AND the ability to have the phone's LED keep blinking until the messages are opened .

title: Coolest app ever
comment: I like this it enables me to see the notification and decide weather to unlock if it is in desk....works fine with my xperia j

title: Doesn't work with sview
comment: Doesn't do anything when the sview is closed, where it could be useful on a note 3

title: Please fix
comment: Would love this feature but I must enable TalkBack on my Note 3 to use this app, so I have to disable so many other features I use (direct pen input, air gesture, air view, multi window, etc)  I just want my phone to auto turn on for a few seconds when it's in sleep when I get a text w/out me having to press home button to check it, like on my iPhone which doesn't need a separate app for this feature. But I also don't wanna have to turn off these other features I use as well. Is there anyway around this?

title: Best app and it's free!
comment: I just got my HTC One and I was missing my notifications as the phone only dings and vibrates but the screen never goes on. Well, this app fixed that and it works. Thank you for the app!

title: Great when it works
comment: It doesn't always work for me. I'm on the HTC one and some times I hear the vibration but it never lights up.

title: Good
comment: It worked most of the time except some glitches.

title: Good app
comment: Thanks

title: Force Reboots my HTC One
comment: This app worked GREAT! had it installed for a long time. Recently after I updated my HTC One to Android 4.3, this app has made my phone reboot randomly throughout the day. Very frustrating. I'd love for there to be a fix. It would be great. Will deff put up 5 star review! Please contact me
Are you sure Screen Notifications is actually causing your phone to reboot?

title: Buggy
comment: Screen times out necessarily - even if the notification is being responded to by opening an app.  The timeout should be only in case the notification has not been responded to isn't it ?

title: Mostly works on S4
comment: The "Open notification tray" setting worked on my S III (i9300) but not with my S4 (i 9505).
Opening the notification tray is not officially supported by Android, depending on the version and the brand it may or may not work

title: New option needed
comment: Can you add to it an option to light up/turn on screen automatically hourly and half hourly ? It would be really nice.

title: Hrc one
comment: Work like a charm on HTC one android 4.3 & sense 5.5. In app selection I have only selected the messenger/social apps I use. Thanks for the great app.
Screen cycles through lock-unlock loop

title: Great!
comment: Does what it says, exactly what i wanted.

title: Very Simple yet Effective!
comment: Highly recommended!

title: Causes screen to sleep during calls
comment: Normal behavior during a call means the screen sleeps while in close proximity to your face, then comes awake when you pull it away.  This app causes the screen to wake/sleep unpredictably during calls.  When pulling the phone away the screen does not wake, then pressing the power button to wake the screen makes it wake for a split second then sleep again and lick the phone.  This made having the app installed painful so I uninstalled it.  Please fix this bug as I'd love to use this app.

title: Got my Phone stuck
comment: This app froze my Phone had to reinstall the OS
This app does not contain any functionality that could freeze your phone. Even if it did, a reboot would solve it.

title: Wonderful
comment: Since my HTC One doesn't do this and my S4 did,  I missed it. The power button will last longer now I don't have to press it most of the time!

title: Works
comment: It works most of the time. Sometimes it's delayed but still the light comes on. It's the only app I've tried that worked on my phone.

title: using HTC One
comment: i realize my lock screen wouldnt light up when receiving messages so i dl this app, quite useful to me BUT why does the screen keep lighting up suddenly and it seems to never stop even after i lock it back manually...

title: Good App, Turn off Proximity Sensor!
comment: This app did what I wanted it to do just turn off the Proximity sensor & you're good so it doesn't drain your battery.  EDIT: turned off proximity sensor and it appears to be working like a charm. Thanks!
If you are having battery issues, disabling the proximity sensor will fix them.

title: Nice tool.
comment: Good app! I use it on my Nexus 4 to light up screen for any notifications from fb messenger, whatsapp and hangouts. But i feel it uses battery more than any other service. Seriously equal to cell standby?!
You may want to disable the proximity sensor to save battery

title: Great
comment: Awesome for HTC One.

title: WON'T WORK
comment: SELECTED MESSAGING AND MESSAGING EXTENSION AS APPS FOR SCREEN TO LIGHT UP FOR BUT NOTHING HAPPENS ON SONY ERICSSON NEO V. THE APP LOOKS LIKE IT SHOULD WORK. I USE NOTIFY FOR CALLS ONLY WHICH IS A GREAT APP AND IS A SIMILAR IDEA, BUT DON'T LIKE THE WAY NOTIFY SHOWS TEXT MESSAGE CONTENT ON SCREEN SO KEEP IT JUST FOR MISSED CALLS.

title: Works okay
comment: It does what is says but it keeps the screen on for to long and I am unable to ignore a phone call now
The screen can only be turned off for wake lengths of 10 seconds or more, shorter wake lengths will cause the phone to default to you normal screen timeout with is usually a minute or two.

title: Awesome!
comment: I used this app as a tweak to light up my screen when I get a notification my HTC One.     I had to stop using it though because I believe HTC has a bug where when you turn on accessibility to use this app, it makes the lock screen turn off with a simple touch rather than a swype. Very annoying and casues me to open my phone on accident and answer calls I don't mean to. Maybe the developer can find away around this bug or else I'll just have to wait for HTC to fix the problem.

title: Really Good, Handy ... But
comment: This app is very handy on ny one x so I can look at a text without even a press of a button, thing is when I turn of or restart my phone it disables and I need to re-activate it but other than that great app

title: Doesn't work
comment: I can't see any change on my nexus 4
Does what it says

title: useful but buggy?
comment: my screen will turn on as expected but it does not turn off in the time specified
It is only possible to turn the screen off after it is turned on if your wake length is 10 seconds or longer, this appears to be an Android limitation

title: Extremely useful
comment: Does what it says, screen on for any app you want!

title: Awesome
comment: Really good app. Initially had the TTS issue but after disabling it, works perfectly.

title: Works Perfectly on Droid DNA!
comment: Perfect app, does everything it says. I have no issues with the HTC lockscreen shortcut buttons on the DNA nor the notification tray drop down, everything works great! Thanks!

title: Great
comment: Awesome app. Very helpful. Only thing is how do I disable the tap to unlock thing. All I really want is the notifications
There is a great big **HTC One Users** banner at the top of the description that describes the issue, it is an HTC bug and can only be fixed by HTC.

title: Very Good..
comment: Using this with an HTC One. Works very well, however with the Gmail app, it wakes the screen up when I receive a new email but doesn't show a pop up with the email preview on the screen like it does with SMS/Whatsapp, etc.
Your SMS app or Whatsapp are likely generating the popups, this app will only turn the screen on, it does not create popups

title: Works great:)
comment: The thing I missed on my android phone was the screen not turning on for notifications like my iPhone 4 did. Now I have it back:D

title: Brilliant app
comment: Just what I wanted. I'll be very grateful if you can make the notification experiment work for nexus 4. Its 5 stars either way.. Thanks!
Sadly opening the notification bar is not supported on most version of Android, if it does not work after enabling it, it is not possible to make it work.

title: almost perfect
comment: Everything works awesome.  No delay.  Led sometime doesn't work.  I can't use my lock screen short cut icon.  I have to unlock the lock screen.  In my work environment, the lock screen short cut is very useful for me.  Yea, forgot to mention I have HTC one.

The led is typically disabled when the screen comes on. If you are on an HTC One, lockscreen shortcuts not working is a known issue that is a result of an HTC bug with accessibility services, more info can be found here http://forums.getpebble.com/discussion/comment/38952

title: Works perfectly
comment: The app is light, and works flawlessly without any delay. awesome work!

title: Awesome utility
comment: The I was looking for something that soon turned on my screen after a text like my iPhone. This does the job very well. The only issue is that it takes about five or so seconds to turn on the screen. Granted that this is a very new phone. Would love to have this little issue resolved.
Are you using the option to open the notification tray? If so the delay is added on purpose because as soon as the screen is turned on and the tray is opened, the sound and vibration is canceled.

title: Not perfect for Nexus 4
comment: When I used this on Galaxy S2, it was perfect but it needs work on Nexus 4. It will turn the screen on for texts but will not turn off after 10 seconds as I've set it. Doesn't work for Google Talk at all.

There is no way for an app to turn the screen off, so the screen may stay on for up to the length of your screen timeout, 

Google Talk may be creating a notification under a different application name, you may wish to try enabling other Google applications.

Also, please try updating, you are several versions behind.

title: Good app, but LED light will stop
comment: I like the idea and execution of the app. Does what I wanted from it. Except, the LED lights will not blink anymore because the screen automatically turns on, thus disabling the light. If I am not around to see my notification, the LED light will missing.

title: Just like my iPhone Notifications
comment: I missed only one thing coming from my iphone, and it was getting a message and just looking at the phone to see it without having the manually hit the power button (htc one with a physical button). This app added that functionality and added additional that is messing from the iphone.   Perfect!  Edit: I have used it a little more. I have been having issues with the lock screen not having to swipe to unlock. I disabled the proximity sensor so that if i got an email, it would still light up and I could pull the phone out and see it. With the lock screen not needing a swipe, the phone would be unlocked by either my leg or my hand grabbing it from the pocket. I answered 2 calls i didn't want. I had to uninstall it.
I have finally tracked down the issue, it is a bug in the HTC lockscreen. You can read more here http://forums.getpebble.com/discussion/5018/pebble-seems-to-break-htc-one-lock-screen-icons

title: App is a Pos
comment: Crashes while loading the apps, so u can't even use it
Just released an update that should fix this.

title: Does exactly what it is suppose to do!!
comment: This app is awesome !  Work straight out of the box.

title: May Cause Audio Problems
comment: On my Nexus 4, this app causes a clicking noise to come through my headphones. Was able to fix the clicking noise by disabling the proximity sensor use (in the app), and then restarting the phone. Other than that, app works perfectly.  Developer contacted me and said that he would be adding a note about this. According to the developer (I also agree with this), it's probably due to bad shielding of the proximity sensor from the audio stuff.
Please send an email describing your issues.

title: Flawless
comment: Ughhh android gives me a boner!!! This was such an easy app to use! I'm an atheist and starting to believe in god cuz of android. Lol

title: works !
comment: works just as it says :) Happy !

title: Perfect
comment: Extremely easy to set up and it works without a flaw or hiccup. Awesome!

title: Awesome
comment: Thus developer is lightning fast in fixing the application. Application does what it claims. Good job.

title: Stopped working
comment: App no longer remembers which apps I want to turn the screen on after today's update. Uninstalled.
0.76 has fixed this issue

title: SGS2 ICS 4.0.4
comment: This is just what I was looking for, an app that turns the screen on without popups that I have to dismiss every time.

title: fantastic
comment: On S3 it works like a charm opening the notifications tray. to ppl complaining about talking phones its a google bug, try disabling tts from setup/applications

title: Media sound annoying
comment: If possible can allow users to on or off the sound when using this application.. Overall this application is very good.. :-) simple and useful..
This is a Samsung bug, they have started releasing updates to fix it, but not all phones have gotten it. You can try disabling Samsung TTS and Google TTS to try and fix it, it may or may not work.

title: Great App......
comment: I love this app, does exactly what I need....almost......... maybe it could actually display the Sender, Subject and a few lines of latest email on the lock screen.  This way you wouldn't have to pull down the notification bar.

title: Clicking
comment: This app causes a clicking sound when using headphones.  Happens during calls and music.  Hopefully this get worked out since app was useful.
The clicking is caused by the proximity sensor, the current fix is to disable the "Use proximity sensor" option in the app and restart your phone.

title: Nice, but...
comment: Very nice app, great idea. Would get 5 stars, but for some weird reason, my phone starts talking when I open any folder, if this app is running.
This is a known Samsung bug, they have begun releasing a fix for this, but you can also try disabling Samsung TTS and Google TTS in the device's menu.

title: Good apps
comment: Very good apps let you choose what important things to show

title: great app
comment: i have it set on for facebook, messenger (facebook), and messaging (texts) so when they phone is on silent, i see a little notification for 10 seconds. thank you luke :)
causes my meizu to turn the screen on whenever i get near the proximity sensor

title: Very good
comment: Awesome app. The only thing is for the RAZR maxx it doesn't keep the screen at its current brightness it turns on at 0% brightness.

title: Extremely useful
comment: This app works perfectly and reliably! I love how you can activate the proximity sensor so the screen doesn't turn on in your pocket. Great app with great, fast updates!

title: Dead useful, extremely reliable
comment: Does exactly what it says - Switches on the screen when a notification is received! Extremely useful for times when your phone is on silent mode without vibration but is within sight.  Extremely reliable too. Has never crashed, or "forgot" to wake up the screen ever.  Very much recommended!

title: Nice
comment: Include backlight flashing option

title: Great!
comment: It is a great workaround for those phones like my xperia ray that need the screen on to turn on the led notifications!
